<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Groups </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Destroys the given group. <u>Group must be empty and local to the machine executing command</u>. <br><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value>In Arma 3 you can find out locality of the group with [[local]] command, unlike with previous games. However [[owner]] and [[setOwner]] dont work with groups anywhere. The group will always be local to the client that created it, until the client disconnects, then the group becomes local to the server. So if you need to delete a group, delete all members first then execute [[deleteGroup]] where is it [[local]]. </value></part></template><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>In Arma 3 when last unit leaves a group, the group gets [[Talk:deleteGroup#group_auto_becoming_null|auto deleted]]. Manually deleting all units from a group however, does not auto delete the empty group. To force the group to get auto-deleted when empty use [[deleteGroupWhenEmpty]]</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''deleteGroup''' group</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> group: [[Group]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>'''deleteGroup''' _groupname</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[deleteGroupWhenEmpty]], [[isGroupDeletedWhenEmpty]], [[createGroup]], [[units]], [[group]], [[groupFromNetId]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 17, 2006 - 00:34
<dt class="note">[[User:ColonelSandersLite|ColonelSandersLite]]<dd class="note"><br>
The deleteGroup Command does not work when there are living members of in the group.  It doesn't error, it simply doesn't do anything.<br>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 07:50, 10 July 2007 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:5133p39|5133p39]]<dd class="note">Living or not doesn't matter - you can't delete the group while it contains any units - even dead ones. It takes few seconds until a dead unit is automatically removed from its group.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 12, 2013 - 03:54
<dt class="note">[[User:LongEnoughName|LongEnoughName]]<dd class="note">deleteGroup will only delete local groups even if called by server. Say we have a situation where client creates a group and puts a unit there and later unit dies\gets deleted, server will not be able to delete that empty group until client leaves the game and group ownership switches to server

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
